section.title: Keyman Configuration - Keyboard Layouts Tab
section.para: The Keyboard Layouts tab of Keyman Configuration lists all the Keyman keyboards which are currently installed on your computer. You can use the Keyboard Layouts tab to install and uninstall keyboards, enable and disable keyboards, set keyboard hotkeys, show keyboard help and view keyboard details.
To open the Keyboard Layouts tab of Keyman Configuration:

listitem.para: Click on the Keyman Desktop icon , on the Windows Taskbar near the clock.
From the Keyman Desktop menu, select Configuration….
Select the Keyboard Layouts tab.
listitem.tip: Keyman Configuration opens in the same tab you last closed it in.

section.para: There are two ways to install a Keyman keyboard from the Keyboard Layouts tab of Keyman Configuration:

listitem.para: To install a keyboard layout from a local folder, see: Installing a Keyman keyboard from a Folder on Your Computer
To install a keyboard layout online, see: Downloading & Installing a Keyman Keyboard within Keyman Desktop

To set a hotkey for a Keyman keyboard from the Keyboard Layouts tab of Keyman Configuration:

listitem.para: Find a keyboard in the keyboard list.
Click on the (no hotkey) or current hotkey link found beside the keyboard name. The Change Hotkey dialog box will be displayed.
Select a default hotkey or click Custom and type the hotkey you wish to use.

note.para: If you press a single letter or Shift plus a single letter, the hotkey will default to Ctrl + Alt plus the letter you pressed, in order to avoid conflicts with standard keyboard input.
To clear a hotkey that has been set previously, click Clear Hotkey or press Backspace.
Be aware that you can set the hotkey to replace common Windows hotkeys (Ctrl + C, Ctrl + V, etc).

listitem.para: Click OK to save your selection.
Click OK again from the Configuration window to apply the changes.

section.para: The new hotkey will now be available.
To show introductory help for a Keyman keyboard from the Keyboard Layouts tab of Keyman Configuration:

listitem.para: Find a keyboard in the keyboard list.
Click on the question mark icon () beside the keyboard name. The keyboard help documentation will be shown.

section.para: To view details for a Keyman keyboard from the Keyboard Layouts tab of Keyman Configuration:

listitem.para: Find a keyboard in the keyboard list.
Click on the down arrow () beside the keyboard name. The keyboard information window will expand.
In the information window you can view keyboard details, including:
Keyboard filename.
Keyboard package name.
Keyboard version number.
Keyboard encodings.
Keyboard layout type.
On Screen Keyboard status.
Documentation status.
Copyright details.
Installation details.
